title: Cybersecurity Response Strategy Knowledge Graph Design and Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge (linear algebra, probability theory), programming experience (Python), and understanding of RDF data formats
context.additional_context: Knowledge graph construction and expansion project based on real cybersecurity scenarios, with team-based collaborative learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically represent and analyze entity-relation-entity triple structures in knowledge graphs.
Learners can design a system to predict missing cybersecurity response strategies using embedding models (e.g., TransE, DistMult).
Learners can implement methods to improve knowledge graph completeness and accuracy by 20% or more through link prediction tasks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
